00024 /* Before using cfortran.h on CRAY, RS/6000, Apollo >=6.8, gcc -ansi,
00025    or any other ANSI C compiler, you must once do:
00026 prompt> mv cfortran.h cf_temp.h && sed 's/\/\*\*\//\#\#/g' cf_temp.h >cfortran.h
00027    i.e. we change the ' / * * / ' kludge to # #. */

00046 #if (!defined(__GNUC__) && (defined(sun)||defined(VAXUltrix)||defined(lynx)))
00047 #define __CF__KnR     /* Sun, LynxOS and VAX Ultrix cc only supports K&R.     */
00048                       /* Manually define __CF__KnR for HP if desired/required.*/
00049 #endif                /*       i.e. We will generate Kernighan and Ritchie C. */
00050 /* Note that you may define __CF__KnR before #include cfortran.h, in order to
00051 generate K&R C instead of the default ANSI C. The differences are mainly in the
00052 function prototypes and declarations. All machines, except the Apollo, work
00053 with either style. The Apollo's argument promotion rules require ANSI or use of
00054 the obsolete std_$call which we have not implemented here. Hence on the Apollo,
00055 only C calling FORTRAN subroutines will work using K&R style.*/
00056

00102 /* Throughout cfortran.h we use: UN = Uppercase Name.  LN = Lowercase Name.  */
00103 
00104 #if defined(f2cFortran) || defined(NAGf90Fortran) || defined(DECFortran) || defined(mipsFortran) || defined(apolloFortran) || defined(sunFortran) || defined(extname)
00105 #if defined(f2cFortran)
00106 #define CFC_(UN,LN)            LN##_  /* Lowercase FORTRAN symbols.        */
00107 #else
00108 #define CFC_(UN,LN)            LN##_   /* Lowercase FORTRAN symbols.        */
00109 #endif   /* f2cFortran */
00110 #define orig_fcallsc           CFC_
00111 #else 
00112 #ifdef CRAYFortran
00113 #define CFC_(UN,LN)            UN        /* Uppercase FORTRAN symbols.        */
00114 #define orig_fcallsc(UN,LN)    CFC_(UN,LN)  /* CRAY insists on arg.'s here.   */
00115 #else  /* For following machines one may wish to change the fcallsc default.  */
00116 #define CF_SAME_NAMESPACE
00117 #ifdef vmsFortran
00118 #define CFC_(UN,LN)            LN        /* Either case FORTRAN symbols.      */
00119      /* BUT we usually use UN for C macro to FORTRAN routines, so use LN here,*/
00120      /* because VAX/VMS doesn't do recursive macros.                          */
00121 #define orig_fcallsc(UN,LN)    UN      
00122 #else      /* HP-UX without +ppu or IBMR2 without -qextname. NOT reccomended. */
00123 #define CFC_(UN,LN)            LN        /* Lowercase FORTRAN symbols.        */
00124 #define orig_fcallsc           CFC_
00125 #endif /*  vmsFortran */
00126 #endif /* CRAYFortran */
00127 #endif /* ....Fortran */
00128 
00129 #define fcallsc                      orig_fcallsc
00130 #define preface_fcallsc(P,p,UN,LN)   CFC_(P##UN,p##LN)
00131 #define  append_fcallsc(P,p,UN,LN)   CFC_(UN##P,LN##p)

00180 #define CF_NULL_PROTO
00181 #else                                         /* HP doesn't understand #elif. */
00182 /* Without ANSI prototyping, Apollo promotes float functions to double.    */
00183 /* Note that VAX/VMS, IBM, Mips choke on 'type function(...);' prototypes. */

00187  DEFINITION NAME __attribute((__section(NAME)))

00190  DEFINITION NAME #attribute[section(NAME)]

00192 #endif

00213 #define PGSMIN(A,B) (A<B?A:B)
00214 #define firstindexlength( A) (sizeof(A)     /sizeof(A[0]))
00215 #define secondindexlength(A) (sizeof((A)[0])/sizeof((A)[0][0]))
00216 #ifndef FALSE
00217 #define FALSE (1==0)
00218 #endif

00220 /* Behavior of FORTRAN LOGICAL. All machines' LOGICAL is same size as C's int.
00221 Conversion is automatic except for arrays which require F2CLOGICALV/C2FLOGICALV.
00222 f2c, MIPS f77 [DECstation, SGI], VAX Ultrix f77, CRAY-2, HP-UX f77:  as in C.
00223 VAX/VMS FORTRAN, VAX Ultrix fort, IBM RS/6000 xlf: LS Bit = 0/1 = TRUE/FALSE.
00224 Apollo, non CRAY-2                               : neg.   = TRUE, else FALSE. 
00225 [Apollo accepts -1 as TRUE for function values, but NOT all other neg. values.]
00226 [DECFortran for Ultrix RISC is also called f77 but is the same as VAX/VMS.]   
00227 [MIPS f77 treats .eqv./.neqv. as .eq./.ne. and hence requires LOGICAL_STRICT.]*/
00228 
00229 #define C2FLOGICALV(A,I) \
00230  do {int __i; for(__i=0;__i<I;__i++) A[__i]=C2FLOGICAL(A[__i]); } while (FALSE)
00231 #define F2CLOGICALV(A,I) \
00232  do {int __i; for(__i=0;__i<I;__i++) A[__i]=F2CLOGICAL(A[__i]); } while (FALSE)
00233 
00234 #if defined(apolloFortran) || (defined(CRAYFortran) && !defined(_CRAY2))
00235 #ifndef apolloFortran
00236 #define C2FLOGICAL(L) ((L)?(L)|(1<<sizeof(int)*8-1):(L)&~(1<<sizeof(int)*8-1))
00237 #else
00238 #define C2FLOGICAL(L) ((L)?-1:(L)&~(1<<sizeof(int)*8-1)) /* Apollo Exception  */
00239 #endif
00240 #define F2CLOGICAL(L) ((L)<0?(L):0) 
00241 #else
00242 #if defined(IBMR2Fortran) || defined(vmsFortran) || defined(DECFortran)
00243 #define C2FLOGICAL(L) ((L)?(L)|1:(L)&~(int)1)
00244 #define F2CLOGICAL(L) ((L)&1?(L):0)
00245 #else /* all other machines evaluate LOGICALs as C does. */
00246 #define C2FLOGICAL(L) (L)
00247 #define F2CLOGICAL(L) (L)
00248 #ifndef LOGICAL_STRICT
00249 #undef  C2FLOGICALV
00250 #undef  F2CLOGICALV
00251 #define C2FLOGICALV(A,I)
00252 #define F2CLOGICALV(A,I)
00253 #endif  /* LOGICAL_STRICT */
00254 #endif
00255 #endif
00256 
00257 #ifdef LOGICAL_STRICT
00258 /* Force C2FLOGICAL to generate only the values for either .TRUE. or .FALSE.
00259    This is only needed if you want to do:
00260      logical lvariable
00261      if (lvariable .eq.  .true.) then       ! (1)
00262    instead of
00263      if (lvariable .eqv. .true.) then       ! (2)
00264    - (1) may not even be FORTRAN/77 and that Apollo's f77 and IBM's xlf
00265    refuse to compile (1), so you are probably well advised to stay away from 
00266    (1) and from LOGICAL_STRICT.
00267    - You pay a (slight) performance penalty for using LOGICAL_STRICT. */
00268 #undef C2FLOGICAL
00269 #if defined(apolloFortran) || (defined(CRAYFortran) && !defined(_CRAY2)) || defined(vmsFortran) || defined(DECFortran)
00270 #define C2FLOGICAL(L) ((L)?-1:0) /* These machines use -1/0 for .true./.false.*/
00271 #else
00272 #define C2FLOGICAL(L) ((L)? 1:0) /* All others     use +1/0 for .true./.false.*/
00273 #endif
00274 #endif /* LOGICAL_STRICT */
00275 
00276 /* Convert a vector of C strings into FORTRAN strings. */
00277 #ifndef __CF__KnR
00278 static char *c2fstrv(char* cstr, char *fstr, int elem_len, int sizeofcstr)
00279 #else
00280 static char *c2fstrv(      cstr,       fstr,     elem_len,     sizeofcstr)
00281                      char* cstr; char *fstr; int elem_len; int sizeofcstr;
00282 #endif
00283 { int i,j;
00284 /* elem_len includes \0 for C strings. Fortran strings don't have term. \0.
00285    Useful size of string must be the same in both languages. */
00286 for (i=0; i<sizeofcstr/elem_len; i++) {
00287   for (j=1; j<elem_len && *cstr; j++) *fstr++ = *cstr++;
00288   cstr += 1+elem_len-j;
00289   for (; j<elem_len; j++) *fstr++ = ' ';
00290 } return fstr-sizeofcstr+sizeofcstr/elem_len; }
00291 
00292 /* Convert a vector of FORTRAN strings into C strings. */
00293 #ifndef __CF__KnR
00294 static char *f2cstrv(char *fstr, char* cstr, int elem_len, int sizeofcstr)
00295 #else
00296 static char *f2cstrv(      fstr,       cstr,     elem_len,     sizeofcstr)
00297                      char *fstr; char* cstr; int elem_len; int sizeofcstr; 
00298 #endif
00299 { int i,j;
00300 /* elem_len includes \0 for C strings. Fortran strings don't have term. \0.
00301    Useful size of string must be the same in both languages. */
00302 cstr += sizeofcstr;
00303 fstr += sizeofcstr - sizeofcstr/elem_len;
00304 for (i=0; i<sizeofcstr/elem_len; i++) {
00305   *--cstr = '\0';
00306   for (j=1; j<elem_len; j++) *--cstr = *--fstr;
00307 } return cstr; }
00308 
00309 /* kill the trailing char t's in string s. */
00310 #ifndef __CF__KnR
00311 static char *kill_trailing(char *s, char t)
00312 #else
00313 static char *kill_trailing(      s,      t) char *s; char t;
00314 #endif
00315 {char *e; 
00316 e = s + strlen(s);
00317 if (e>s) {                           /* Need this to handle NULL string.*/
00318   while (e>s && *--e==t);            /* Don't follow t's past beginning. */
00319   e[*e==t?0:1] = '\0';               /* Handle s[0]=t correctly.       */
00320 } return s; }
00321 
00322 /* kill_trailingn(s,t,e) will kill the trailing t's in string s. e normally 
00323 points to the terminating '\0' of s, but may actually point to anywhere in s.
00324 s's new '\0' will be placed at e or earlier in order to remove any trailing t's.
00325 If e<s string s is left unchanged. */ 
00326 #ifndef __CF__KnR
00327 static char *kill_trailingn(char *s, char t, char *e)
00328 #else
00329 static char *kill_trailingn(      s,      t,       e) char *s; char t; char *e;
00330 #endif
00331 { 
00332 if (e==s) *e = '\0';                 /* Kill the string makes sense here.*/
00333 else if (e>s) {                      /* Watch out for neg. length string.*/
00334   while (e>s && *--e==t);            /* Don't follow t's past beginning. */
00335   e[*e==t?0:1] = '\0';               /* Handle s[0]=t correctly.       */
00336 } return s; }
00337 
00338 /* Note the following assumes that any element which has t's to be chopped off,
00339 does indeed fill the entire element. */
00340 #ifndef __CF__KnR
00341 static char *vkill_trailing(char* cstr, int elem_len, int sizeofcstr, char t)
00342 #else
00343 static char *vkill_trailing(      cstr,     elem_len,     sizeofcstr,      t)
00344                             char* cstr; int elem_len; int sizeofcstr; char t;
00345 #endif
00346 { int i;
00347 for (i=0; i<sizeofcstr/elem_len; i++) /* elem_len includes \0 for C strings. */
00348   kill_trailingn(cstr+elem_len*i,t,cstr+elem_len*(i+1)-1);
00349 return cstr; }
00350 
00351 #ifdef vmsFortran
00352 typedef struct dsc$descriptor_s fstring;
00353 #define DSC$DESCRIPTOR_A(DIMCT)                                        \
00354 struct {                                                                       \
00355   unsigned short dsc$w_length;          unsigned char    dsc$b_dtype;          \
00356   unsigned char  dsc$b_class;                    char   *dsc$a_pointer;        \
00357            char  dsc$b_scale;           unsigned char    dsc$b_digits;         \
00358   struct {                                                                     \
00359     unsigned               : 3;   unsigned dsc$v_fl_binscale : 1;      \
00360     unsigned dsc$v_fl_redim    : 1;       unsigned dsc$v_fl_column   : 1;      \
00361     unsigned dsc$v_fl_coeff    : 1;       unsigned dsc$v_fl_bounds   : 1;      \
00362   } dsc$b_aflags;                                                          \
00363   unsigned char  dsc$b_dimct;           unsigned long    dsc$l_arsize;         \
00364            char *dsc$a_a0;                   long    dsc$l_m [DIMCT];      \
00365   struct {                                                                     \
00366     long dsc$l_l;                         long dsc$l_u;                        \
00367   } dsc$bounds [DIMCT];                                                        \
00368 }
00369 typedef DSC$DESCRIPTOR_A(1) fstringvector;
00370 /*typedef DSC$DESCRIPTOR_A(2) fstringarrarr;
00371   typedef DSC$DESCRIPTOR_A(3) fstringarrarrarr;*/
00372 #define initfstr(F,C,ELEMNO,ELEMLEN)                                           \
00373 ( (F).dsc$l_arsize=  ( (F).dsc$w_length                        =(ELEMLEN) )    \
00374                     *( (F).dsc$l_m[0]=(F).dsc$bounds[0].dsc$l_u=(ELEMNO)  ),   \
00375   (F).dsc$a_a0    =  ( (F).dsc$a_pointer=(C) ) - (F).dsc$w_length          ,(F))
00376 
00377 #else
00378 #define _NUM_ELEMS      -1
00379 #define _NUM_ELEM_ARG   -2
00380 #define NUM_ELEMS(A)    A,_NUM_ELEMS
00381 #define NUM_ELEM_ARG(B) *A##B,_NUM_ELEM_ARG
00382 #define TERM_CHARS(A,B) A,B
00383 #ifndef __CF__KnR
00384 static int num_elem(char *strv, unsigned elem_len, int term_char, int num_term)
00385 #else
00386 static int num_elem(      strv,          elem_len,     term_char,     num_term)
00387                     char *strv; unsigned elem_len; int term_char; int num_term;
00388 #endif
00389 /* elem_len is the number of characters in each element of strv, the FORTRAN
00390 vector of strings. The last element of the vector must begin with at least
00391 num_term term_char characters, so that this routine can determine how 
00392 many elements are in the vector. */
00393 {
00394 unsigned num,i;
00395 if (num_term == _NUM_ELEMS || num_term == _NUM_ELEM_ARG) 
00396   return term_char;
00397 if (num_term <=0) num_term = elem_len;
00398 for (num=0; ; num++) {
00399   for (i=0; (int) i<num_term && *strv==(char) term_char; i++,strv++);
00400   if ((int) i==num_term) break;
00401   else strv += elem_len-i;
00402 }
00403 return num;
00404 }
00405 #endif

00408 /*           UTILITIES FOR C TO USE STRINGS IN FORTRAN COMMON BLOCKS       */
00409 
00410 /* C string TO Fortran Common Block STRing. */
00411 /* DIM is the number of DIMensions of the array in terms of strings, not
00412    characters. e.g. char a[12] has DIM = 0, char a[12][4] has DIM = 1, etc. */
00413 #define C2FCBSTR(CSTR,FSTR,DIM)                                                \
00414  c2fstrv((char *)CSTR, (char *)FSTR, sizeof(FSTR)/cfelementsof(FSTR,DIM)+1,    \
00415          sizeof(FSTR)+cfelementsof(FSTR,DIM))
00416 
00417 /* Fortran Common Block string TO C STRing. */
00418 #define FCB2CSTR(FSTR,CSTR,DIM)                                                \
00419  vkill_trailing(f2cstrv((char *)FSTR, (char *)CSTR,                            \
00420                         sizeof(FSTR)/cfelementsof(FSTR,DIM)+1,                 \
00421                         sizeof(FSTR)+cfelementsof(FSTR,DIM)),                  \
00422                 sizeof(FSTR)/cfelementsof(FSTR,DIM)+1,                         \
00423                 sizeof(FSTR)+cfelementsof(FSTR,DIM), ' ')
00424 
00425 #define cfDEREFERENCE0
00426 #define cfDEREFERENCE1 *
00427 #define cfDEREFERENCE2 **
00428 #define cfDEREFERENCE3 ***
00429 #define cfDEREFERENCE4 ****
00430 #define cfDEREFERENCE5 *****
00431 #define cfelementsof(A,D) (sizeof(A)/sizeof(cfDEREFERENCE##D(A)))

00443 static int __cfztringv[30];       /* => 30 == MAX # of arg.'s C can pass to a */
00444 #define ZTRINGV_NUM(I) I          /*          FORTRAN function.               */
00445 #define ZTRINGV_ARGF(I) __cfztringv[I]
00446 #define ZTRINGV_ARGS(I) B##I

00452 #define VPPLOGICAL(A,B) int *B;         /* Returning LOGICAL in FUNn and SUBn.*/
00453 #define VPPLONG         VPPINT

00456 #define VCF(TN,I)       _INT(3,V,TN,A##I,B##I)
00457 #define VVCF(TN,AI,BI)  _INT(3,V,TN,AI,BI)
00458 #define VINT(       T,A,B) typeP##T##VVVVVVV B = A;
00459 #define VINTV(      T,A,B)
00460 #define VINTVV(     T,A,B)
00461 #define VINTVVV(    T,A,B)
00462 #define VINTVVVV(   T,A,B)
00463 #define VINTVVVVV(  T,A,B)
00464 #define VINTVVVVVV( T,A,B)
00465 #define VINTVVVVVVV(T,A,B)

00467 #define VPVOID(     T,A,B)
00468 #ifdef apolloFortran
00469 #define VROUTINE(   T,A,B) void (*B)() = (void (*)())A;
00470 #else
00471 #define VROUTINE(   T,A,B)
00472 #endif
00473 #define VSIMPLE(    T,A,B)
00474 #ifdef vmsFortran
00475 #define VSTRING(    T,A,B) static struct {fstring f; unsigned clen;} B =       \
00476                                        {{0,DSC$K_DTYPE_T,DSC$K_CLASS_S,NULL},0};
00477 #define VPSTRING(   T,A,B) static fstring B={0,DSC$K_DTYPE_T,DSC$K_CLASS_S,NULL};
00478 #define VSTRINGV(   T,A,B) static fstringvector B =                            \
00479   {sizeof(A),DSC$K_DTYPE_T,DSC$K_CLASS_A,NULL,0,0,{0,0,1,1,1},1,0,NULL,0,{1,0}};
00480 #define VPSTRINGV(  T,A,B) static fstringvector B =                            \
00481           {0,DSC$K_DTYPE_T,DSC$K_CLASS_A,NULL,0,0,{0,0,1,1,1},1,0,NULL,0,{1,0}};
00482 #else
00483 #define VSTRING(    T,A,B) struct {unsigned short clen, flen;} B;
00484 #define VSTRINGV(   T,A,B) struct {char *s, *fs; unsigned flen;} B;
00485 #define VPSTRING(   T,A,B) int     B;
00486 #define VPSTRINGV(  T,A,B) struct {char *fs; unsigned short sizeofA, flen;} B;
00487 #endif
00488 #define VZTRINGV         VSTRINGV
00489 #define VPZTRINGV        VPSTRINGV
00490 
00491 /* Note that the actions of the A table were performed inside the AA table.
00492    VAX Ultrix vcc, and HP-UX cc, didn't evaluate arguments to functions left to
00493    right, so we had to split the original table into the current robust two. */
00494 #define ACF(NAME,TN,AI,I)  STR_##TN(4,A,NAME,I,AI,B##I)
00495 #define ALOGICAL( M,I,A,B) B=C2FLOGICAL(B);
00496 #define APLOGICAL(M,I,A,B) A=C2FLOGICAL(A);
00497 #define ASTRING(  M,I,A,B) CSTRING(A,B,sizeof(A))
00498 #define APSTRING( M,I,A,B) CPSTRING(A,B,sizeof(A))
00499 #ifdef vmsFortran
00500 #define AATRINGV( M,I,A,B, sA,filA,silA)                                       \
00501  initfstr(B,malloc((sA)-(filA)),(filA),(silA)-1),                              \
00502           c2fstrv(A[0],B.dsc$a_pointer,(silA),(sA));
00503 #define APATRINGV(M,I,A,B, sA,filA,silA)                                       \
00504  initfstr(B,A[0],(filA),(silA)-1),c2fstrv(A[0],A[0],(silA),(sA));
00505 #else
00506 #define AATRINGV( M,I,A,B, sA,filA,silA)                                       \
00507  (B.s=malloc((sA)-(filA)),B.fs=c2fstrv(A[0],B.s,(B.flen=(silA)-1)+1,(sA)));
00508 #define APATRINGV(M,I,A,B, sA,filA,silA)                                       \
00509  B.fs=c2fstrv(A[0],A[0],(B.flen=(silA)-1)+1,B.sizeofA=(sA));
00510 #endif
00511 #define ASTRINGV( M,I,A,B)                                                     \
00512   AATRINGV( M,I,A,B,sizeof(A),firstindexlength(A),secondindexlength(A)) 
00513 #define APSTRINGV(M,I,A,B)                                                     \
00514  APATRINGV( M,I,A,B,sizeof(A),firstindexlength(A),secondindexlength(A)) 
00515 #define AZTRINGV( M,I,A,B) AATRINGV( M,I,A,B,                                  \
00516                     (M##_ELEMS_##I)*(( M##_ELEMLEN_##I)+1),            \
00517                               (M##_ELEMS_##I),(M##_ELEMLEN_##I)+1) 
00518 #define APZTRINGV(M,I,A,B) APATRINGV( M,I,A,B,                                 \
00519                     (M##_ELEMS_##I)*(( M##_ELEMLEN_##I)+1),            \
00520                               (M##_ELEMS_##I),(M##_ELEMLEN_##I)+1) 
00521 
00522 #define AAPPBYTE(   A,B) &A
00523 #define AAPPDOUBLE( A,B) &A
00524 #define AAPPFLOAT(  A,B) PPFLOATVVVVVVV &A
00525 #define AAPPINT(    A,B) &A
00526 #define AAPPLOGICAL(A,B) B= &A         /* B used to keep a common W table. */
00527 #define AAPPLONG(   A,B) &A
00528 #define AAPPSHORT(  A,B) &A

00530 #define AACF(TN,AI,I,C) _SEP_(TN,C,COMMA) _INT(3,AA,TN,AI,B##I)
00531 #define AAINT(       T,A,B) &B
00532 #define AAINTV(      T,A,B) PP##T##VVVVVV A
00533 #define AAINTVV(     T,A,B) PP##T##VVVVV  A[0]
00534 #define AAINTVVV(    T,A,B) PP##T##VVVV   A[0][0]
00535 #define AAINTVVVV(   T,A,B) PP##T##VVV    A[0][0][0]
00536 #define AAINTVVVVV(  T,A,B) PP##T##VV     A[0][0][0][0]
00537 #define AAINTVVVVVV( T,A,B) PP##T##V      A[0][0][0][0][0]
00538 #define AAINTVVVVVVV(T,A,B) PP##T           A[0][0][0][0][0][0]
00539 #define AAPINT(      T,A,B) AAP##T(A,B)
00540 #define AAPVOID(     T,A,B) (void *) A
00541 #ifdef apolloFortran
00542 #define AAROUTINE(   T,A,B) &B
00543 #else
00544 #define AAROUTINE(   T,A,B)  (void(*)())A
00545 #endif
00546 #define AASTRING(    T,A,B) CCSTRING(T,A,B)
00547 #define AAPSTRING(   T,A,B) CCPSTRING(T,A,B)
00548 #ifdef vmsFortran
00549 #define AASTRINGV(   T,A,B) &B
00550 #else
00551 #ifdef CRAYFortran
00552 #define AASTRINGV(   T,A,B) _cptofcd(B.fs,B.flen)
00553 #else
00554 #define AASTRINGV(   T,A,B) B.fs
00555 #endif
00556 #endif
00557 #define AAPSTRINGV      AASTRINGV
00558 #define AAZTRINGV       AASTRINGV
00559 #define AAPZTRINGV      AASTRINGV

00561 #if defined(vmsFortran) || defined(CRAYFortran)
00562 #define JCF(TN,I)
00563 #else
00564 #define JCF(TN,I)    STR_##TN(1,J,B##I, 0,0,0)
00565 #define JLOGICAL( B)
00566 #define JPLOGICAL(B)
00567 #define JSTRING(  B) ,B.flen
00568 #define JPSTRING( B) ,B
00569 #define JSTRINGV     JSTRING
00570 #define JPSTRINGV    JSTRING
00571 #define JZTRINGV     JSTRING

00573 #endif

00575 #define WCF(TN,AN,I)   STR_##TN(2,W,AN,B##I, 0,0)
00576 #define WLOGICAL( A,B)
00577 #define WPLOGICAL(A,B) *B=F2CLOGICAL(*B);
00578 #define WSTRING(  A,B) (A[B.clen]!='\0'?A[B.clen]='\0':0); /* A?="constnt"*/
00579 #define WPSTRING( A,B) kill_trailing(A,' ');
00580 #ifdef vmsFortran
00581 #define WSTRINGV( A,B) free(B.dsc$a_pointer);
00582 #define WPSTRINGV(A,B)                                                         \
00583   vkill_trailing(f2cstrv((char*)A, (char*)A,                                   \
00584                            B.dsc$w_length+1, B.dsc$l_arsize+B.dsc$l_m[0]),     \
00585                    B.dsc$w_length+1, B.dsc$l_arsize+B.dsc$l_m[0], ' ');
00586 #else
00587 #define WSTRINGV( A,B) free(B.s);
00588 #define WPSTRINGV(A,B) vkill_trailing(                                         \
00589          f2cstrv((char*)A,(char*)A,B.flen+1,B.sizeofA), B.flen+1,B.sizeofA,' ');
00590 #endif
00591 #define WZTRINGV           WSTRINGV
00592 #define WPZTRINGV          WPSTRINGV

00594 #define   NCF(TN,I,C)  _SEP_(TN,C,COMMA) _INT(2,N,TN,A##I,0)

00597 #define NINT(       T,A) typeP##T##VVVVVVV * A
00598 #define NINTV(      T,A) typeP##T##VVVVVV  * A

00601 #define NINTVVVV(   T,A) typeP##T##VVV     * A

00606 #define NPVOID(     T,A) void *                  A

00609 #else
00610 #define NROUTINE(   T,A) void ( *A)()
00611 #endif

00615 #else

00621 #define NSTRINGV(   T,A) char *             A
00622 #endif
00623 #endif

00626 #define NPPSTRING(  T,A) NSTRING(T,A)   /* CRAY insists on arg.'s here. */

00717 #define CCALLSFSUB19(UN,LN,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,TA,TB,TC,TD,TE,TF,TG,TH,TI,TJ,A1,A2,A3,A4,A5,A6,A7,A8,A9,AA,AB,AC,AD,AE,AF,AG,AH,AI,AJ)\
00718         CCALLSFSUB20(UN,LN,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,TA,TB,TC,TD,TE,TF,TG,TH,TI,TJ,CF_0,A1,A2,A3,A4,A5,A6,A7,A8,A9,AA,AB,AC,AD,AE,AF,AG,AH,AI,AJ,0)
00719 
00720 /* PROTOCCALLSFSUB20 is commented out, because it chokes the VAX VMS compiler.
00721    It isn't required since we so far only pass pointers and integers to 
00722    FORTRAN routines and these arg.'s aren't promoted to anything else.        */
00723 
00724 #define CCALLSFSUB20(UN,LN,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,TA,TB,TC,TD,TE,TF,TG,TH, \
00725         TI,TJ,TK, A1,A2,A3,A4,A5,A6,A7,A8,A9,AA,AB,AC,AD,AE,AF,AG,AH,AI,AJ,AK) \
00726 do{VVCF(T1,A1,B1) VVCF(T2,A2,B2) VVCF(T3,A3,B3) VVCF(T4,A4,B4) VVCF(T5,A5,B5)  \
00727    VVCF(T6,A6,B6) VVCF(T7,A7,B7) VVCF(T8,A8,B8) VVCF(T9,A9,B9) VVCF(TA,AA,BA)  \
00728    VVCF(TB,AB,BB) VVCF(TC,AC,BC) VVCF(TD,AD,BD) VVCF(TE,AE,BE) VVCF(TF,AF,BF)  \
00729    VVCF(TG,AG,BG) VVCF(TH,AH,BH) VVCF(TI,AI,BI) VVCF(TJ,AJ,BJ) VVCF(TK,AK,BK)  \
00730 /*   PROTOCCALLSFSUB20(UN,LN,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,TA,TB,TC,TD,TE,TF,TG,TH,TI,TJ,TK)*/\
00731    ACF(LN,T1,A1,1) ACF(LN,T2,A2,2) ACF(LN,T3,A3,3) ACF(LN,T4,A4,4)             \
00732    ACF(LN,T5,A5,5) ACF(LN,T6,A6,6) ACF(LN,T7,A7,7) ACF(LN,T8,A8,8)             \
00733    ACF(LN,T9,A9,9) ACF(LN,TA,AA,A) ACF(LN,TB,AB,B) ACF(LN,TC,AC,C)             \
00734    ACF(LN,TD,AD,D) ACF(LN,TE,AE,E) ACF(LN,TF,AF,F) ACF(LN,TG,AG,G)             \
00735    ACF(LN,TH,AH,H) ACF(LN,TI,AI,I) ACF(LN,TJ,AJ,J) ACF(LN,TK,AK,K)             \
00736    CFC_(UN,LN)(AACF(T1,A1,1,0) AACF(T2,A2,2,1) AACF(T3,A3,3,1) AACF(T4,A4,4,1) \
00737                AACF(T5,A5,5,1) AACF(T6,A6,6,1) AACF(T7,A7,7,1) AACF(T8,A8,8,1) \
00738                AACF(T9,A9,9,1) AACF(TA,AA,A,1) AACF(TB,AB,B,1) AACF(TC,AC,C,1) \
00739                AACF(TD,AD,D,1) AACF(TE,AE,E,1) AACF(TF,AF,F,1) AACF(TG,AG,G,1) \
00740                AACF(TH,AH,H,1) AACF(TI,AI,I,1) AACF(TJ,AJ,J,1) AACF(TK,AK,K,1) \
00741       JCF(T1,1) JCF(T2,2) JCF(T3,3) JCF(T4,4) JCF(T5,5) JCF(T6,6) JCF(T7,7)    \
00742       JCF(T8,8) JCF(T9,9) JCF(TA,A) JCF(TB,B) JCF(TC,C) JCF(TD,D) JCF(TE,E)    \
00743       JCF(TF,F) JCF(TG,G) JCF(TH,H) JCF(TI,I) JCF(TJ,J) JCF(TK,K)          );  \
00744  WCF(T1,A1,1) WCF(T2,A2,2) WCF(T3,A3,3) WCF(T4,A4,4) WCF(T5,A5,5) WCF(T6,A6,6) \
00745  WCF(T7,A7,7) WCF(T8,A8,8) WCF(T9,A9,9) WCF(TA,AA,A) WCF(TB,AB,B) WCF(TC,AC,C) \
00746  WCF(TD,AD,D) WCF(TE,AE,E) WCF(TF,AF,F) WCF(TG,AG,G) WCF(TH,AH,H) WCF(TI,AI,I) \
00747  WCF(TJ,AJ,J) WCF(TK,AK,K) }while(FALSE)
00748 #endif         /* Apollo 6.7, CRAY, Sun and HP can't hack more than 31 arg.'s */
00749 
00750 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00751 
00752 /*               UTILITIES FOR C TO CALL FORTRAN FUNCTIONS                 */
00753 
00754 /*N.B. PROTOCCALLSFFUNn(..) generates code, whether or not the FORTRAN
00755   function is called. Therefore, especially for creator's of C header files
00756   for large FORTRAN libraries which include many functions, to reduce
00757   compile time and object code size, it may be desirable to create
00758   preprocessor directives to allow users to create code for only those
00759   functions which they use.                                                */
00760 
00761 /* The following defines the maximum length string that a function can return.
00762    Of course it may be undefine-d and re-define-d before individual
00763    PROTOCCALLSFFUNn(..) as required. It would also be nice to have this derived
00764    from the individual machines' limits.                                      */
00765 #define MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING 0x4FE
00766 
00767 /* The following defines a character used by CFORTRAN.H to flag the end of a
00768    string coming out of a FORTRAN routine.                                 */
00769 #define CFORTRAN_NON_CHAR 0x7F
00770 
00771 #ifdef OLD_VAXC                                /* Prevent %CC-I-PARAMNOTUSED. */
00772 #pragma nostandard
00773 #endif
00774 
00775 #define _SEP_(TN,C,COMMA) __SEP_##C(TN,COMMA)
00776 #define __SEP_0(TN,COMMA)  
00777 #define __SEP_1(TN,COMMA)  _INT(2,SEP_,TN,COMMA,0)
00778 #define SEP_INT(T,B)   A##B
00779 #define SEP_INTV       SEP_INT
00780 #define SEP_INTVV      SEP_INT
00781 #define SEP_INTVVV     SEP_INT
00782 #define SEP_INTVVVV    SEP_INT
00783 #define SEP_INTVVVVV   SEP_INT
00784 #define SEP_INTVVVVVV  SEP_INT
00785 #define SEP_INTVVVVVVV SEP_INT
00786 #define SEP_PINT       SEP_INT
00787 #define SEP_PVOID      SEP_INT
00788 #define SEP_ROUTINE    SEP_INT
00789 #define SEP_SIMPLE     SEP_INT
00790 #define SEP_VOID       SEP_INT    /* Need for FORTRAN calls to C subroutines. */
00791 #define SEP_STRING     SEP_INT
00792 #define SEP_STRINGV    SEP_INT
00793 #define SEP_PSTRING    SEP_INT
00794 #define SEP_PSTRINGV   SEP_INT
00795 #define SEP_PNSTRING   SEP_INT
00796 #define SEP_PPSTRING   SEP_INT
00797 #define SEP_STRVOID     SEP_INT
00798 #define SEP_ZTRINGV    SEP_INT
00799 #define SEP_PZTRINGV   SEP_INT
00800                          
00801 #if defined(SIGNED_BYTE) || !defined(UNSIGNED_BYTE)
00802 #ifdef OLD_VAXC
00803 #define INTEGER_BYTE               char    /* Old VAXC barfs on 'signed char' */
00804 #else
00805 #define INTEGER_BYTE        signed char    /* default */
00806 #endif
00807 #else
00808 #define INTEGER_BYTE        unsigned char
00809 #endif

00822 #define CFARGS4(A,T,W,X,Y,Z) A##T(W,X,Y,Z)

00891   define macros to macros with arguments. */

00906 #define   UCF(TN,I,C)  _SEP_(TN,C,COMMA) _INT(2,U,TN,A##I,0)
00907 #define  UUCF(TN,I,C)  _SEP_(TN,C,COMMA) _SEP_(TN,1,I) 
00908 #define UUUCF(TN,I,C)  _SEP_(TN,C,COLON) _INT(2,U,TN,A##I,0)
00909 #define UINT(       T,A) typeP##T##VVVVVVV  A
00910 #define UINTV(      T,A) typeP##T##VVVVVV  *A
00911 #define UINTVV(     T,A) typeP##T##VVVVV   *A
00912 #define UINTVVV(    T,A) typeP##T##VVVV    *A
00913 #define UINTVVVV(   T,A) typeP##T##VVV     *A
00914 #define UINTVVVVV(  T,A) typeP##T##VV      *A
00915 #define UINTVVVVVV( T,A) typeP##T##V       *A
00916 #define UINTVVVVVVV(T,A) typeP##T            *A
00917 #define UPINT(      T,A)  type##T##VVVVVVV *A
00918 #define UPVOID(     T,A) void *A 
00919 #define UROUTINE(   T,A) void (*A)() 
00920 #define UVOID(      T,A) void  A     /* Needed for C calls FORTRAN subroutines. */
00921 #define USTRING(    T,A) char *A     /*            via VOID and wrapper.        */
00922 #define USTRINGV(   T,A) char *A
00923 #define UPSTRING(   T,A) char *A
00924 #define UPSTRINGV(  T,A) char *A
00925 #define UZTRINGV(   T,A) char *A
00926 #define UPZTRINGV(  T,A) char *A
00927 
00928 /* VOID breaks U into U and UU. */
00929 #define UUINT(      T,A) typeP##T##VVVVVVV  A
00930 #define UUVOID(     T,A)           /* Needed for FORTRAN calls C subroutines. */
00931 #define UUSTRING(   T,A) char *A 
00932 
00933 /* Sun and VOID break U into U and PU. */
00934 #define PUBYTE(      A) INTEGER_BYTE     A
00935 #define PUDOUBLE(    A) DOUBLE_PRECISION A
00936 #ifndef sunFortran
00937 #define PUFLOAT(     A) float   A
00938 #else
00939 #define PUFLOAT(     A) FLOATFUNCTIONTYPE   A
00940 #endif
00941 #define PUINT(       A) int     A
00942 #define PULOGICAL(   A) int     A
00943 #define PULONG(      A) long    A
00944 #define PUSHORT(     A) short   A
00945 #define PUSTRING(    A) char   *A 
00946 #define PUVOID(      A) void    A
00947 
00948 #define EBYTE          INTEGER_BYTE     A0;
00949 #define EDOUBLE        DOUBLE_PRECISION A0;
00950 #ifndef sunFortran
00951 #define EFLOAT         float  A0;
00952 #else
00953 #define EFLOAT         float AA0;   FLOATFUNCTIONTYPE A0;
00954 #endif
00955 #define EINT           int    A0;
00956 #define ELOGICAL       int    A0;
00957 #define ELONG          long   A0;
00958 #define ESHORT         short  A0;
00959 #define EVOID
00960 #ifdef vmsFortran
00961 #define ESTRING        static char AA0[MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING+1];     \
00962                        static fstring A0 =                                     \
00963              {MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING,DSC$K_DTYPE_T,DSC$K_CLASS_S,AA0};\
00964                memset(AA0, CFORTRAN_NON_CHAR, MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING);\
00965                                     *(AA0+MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING)='\0';
00966 #else
00967 #ifdef CRAYFortran
00968 #define ESTRING        static char AA0[MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING+1];     \
00969                    static _fcd A0; *(AA0+MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING)='\0';\
00970                 memset(AA0,CFORTRAN_NON_CHAR, MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING);\
00971                             A0 = _cptofcd(AA0,MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING);
00972 #else
00973 #define ESTRING        static char A0[MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING+1];      \
00974                        memset(A0, CFORTRAN_NON_CHAR,                           \
00975                               MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING);                \
00976                        *(A0+MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING)='\0';
00977 #endif
00978 #endif
00979 /* ESTRING must use static char. array which is guaranteed to exist after
00980    function returns.                                                     */
00981 
00982 /* N.B.i) The diff. for 0 (Zero) and >=1 arguments.
00983        ii)That the following create an unmatched bracket, i.e. '(', which
00984           must of course be matched in the call.
00985        iii)Commas must be handled very carefully                         */
00986 #define GZINT(    T,UN,LN) A0=CFC_(UN,LN)(
00987 #define GZVOID(   T,UN,LN)    CFC_(UN,LN)(
00988 #ifdef vmsFortran
00989 #define GZSTRING( T,UN,LN)    CFC_(UN,LN)(&A0
00990 #else
00991 #ifdef CRAYFortran
00992 #define GZSTRING( T,UN,LN)    CFC_(UN,LN)( A0
00993 #else
00994 #define GZSTRING( T,UN,LN)    CFC_(UN,LN)( A0,MAX_LEN_FORTRAN_FUNCTION_STRING
00995 #endif
00996 #endif
00997 
00998 #define GINT               GZINT
00999 #define GVOID              GZVOID
01000 #define GSTRING(  T,UN,LN) GZSTRING(T,UN,LN),

01007 #define   PPSHORTVVVVVVV

01154 /* See ACF table comments, which explain why CCF was split into two. */
01155 #define CCF(TN,I)          STR_##TN(3,C,A##I,B##I,C##I,0)
01156 #define CLOGICAL( A,B,C)  A=C2FLOGICAL( A);
01157 #define CPLOGICAL(A,B,C) *A=C2FLOGICAL(*A);
01158 #ifdef vmsFortran
01159 #define CSTRING(  A,B,C) (B.clen=strlen(A),B.f.dsc$a_pointer=A,                \
01160                     C==sizeof(char*)||C==B.clen+1?B.f.dsc$w_length=B.clen:     \
01161           (memset((A)+B.clen,' ',C-B.clen-1),A[B.f.dsc$w_length=C-1]='\0'));
01162 #define CSTRINGV( A,B,C) (                                                     \
01163           initfstr(B, malloc((C/0xFFFF)*(C%0xFFFF-1)), C/0xFFFF, C%0xFFFF-1),  \
01164           c2fstrv(A,B.dsc$a_pointer,C%0xFFFF,(C/0xFFFF)*(C%0xFFFF)) );
01165 #define CPSTRING( A,B,C) (B.dsc$w_length=strlen(A),B.dsc$a_pointer=A,          \
01166         C==sizeof(char*)?0:(memset((A)+B.dsc$w_length,' ',C-B.dsc$w_length-1), \
01167                              A[B.dsc$w_length=C-1]='\0'));
01168 #define CPSTRINGV(A,B,C)  (initfstr(B, A, C/0xFFFF, C%0xFFFF-1),               \
01169                              c2fstrv(A,A,C%0xFFFF,(C/0xFFFF)*(C%0xFFFF)) );
01170 #else
01171 #ifdef CRAYFortran
01172 #define CSTRING(  A,B,C) (B.clen=strlen(A),                                    \
01173                           C==sizeof(char*)||C==B.clen+1?B.flen=B.clen:         \
01174                         (memset((A)+B.clen,' ',C-B.clen-1),A[B.flen=C-1]='\0'));
01175 #define CSTRINGV( A,B,C) (B.s=malloc((C/0xFFFF)*(C%0xFFFF-1)),                 \
01176                     c2fstrv(A,B.s,(B.flen=C%0xFFFF-1)+1,(C/0xFFFF)*(C%0xFFFF)));
01177 #define CPSTRING( A,B,C) (B=strlen(A), C==sizeof(char*)?0:                     \
01178                             (memset((A)+B,' ',C-B-1),A[B=C-1]='\0'));
01179 #define CPSTRINGV(A,B,C) c2fstrv(A,A,(B.flen=C%0xFFFF-1)+1,                    \
01180                                    B.sizeofA=(C/0xFFFF)*(C%0xFFFF));
01181 #else
01182 #define CSTRING(  A,B,C) (B.clen=strlen(A),                                    \
01183                             C==sizeof(char*)||C==B.clen+1?B.flen=B.clen:       \
01184                         (memset((A)+B.clen,' ',C-B.clen-1),A[B.flen=C-1]='\0'));
01185 #define CSTRINGV( A,B,C) (B.s=malloc((C/0xFFFF)*(C%0xFFFF-1)),                 \
01186                B.fs=c2fstrv(A,B.s,(B.flen=C%0xFFFF-1)+1,(C/0xFFFF)*(C%0xFFFF)));
01187 #define CPSTRING( A,B,C) (B=strlen(A), C==sizeof(char*)?0:                     \
01188                             (memset((A)+B,' ',C-B-1),A[B=C-1]='\0'));
01189 #define CPSTRINGV(A,B,C) B.fs=c2fstrv(A,A,(B.flen=C%0xFFFF-1)+1,               \
01190                                         B.sizeofA=(C/0xFFFF)*(C%0xFFFF));
01191 #endif
01192 #endif
01193 #define CZTRINGV         CSTRINGV
01194 #define CPZTRINGV        CPSTRINGV

01310 
01311 /*  N.B. Create a separate function instead of using (call function, function
01312 value here) because in order to create the variables needed for the input
01313 arg.'s which may be const.'s one has to do the creation within {}, but these
01314 can never be placed within ()'s. Therefore one must create wrapper functions.
01315 gcc, on the other hand may be able to avoid the wrapper functions. */
01316 
01317 /* Prototypes are needed to correctly handle the value returned correctly. N.B.
01318 Can only have prototype arg.'s with difficulty, a la G... table since FORTRAN
01319 functions returning strings have extra arg.'s. Don't bother, since this only
01320 causes a compiler warning to come up when one uses FCALLSCFUNn and CCALLSFFUNn
01321 for the same function in the same source code. Something done by the experts in
01322 debugging only.*/    
01323 
01324 #define PROTOCCALLSFFUN0(F,UN,LN)                                              \
01325 PU##F( CFC_(UN,LN))(CF_NULL_PROTO);                                          \
01326 static _INT(2,U,F,CFFUN(UN),0)() {E##F  _INT(3,GZ,F,UN,LN)); X##F}
01327

01330 #define PROTOCCALLSFFUN2( T0,UN,LN,T1,T2)                                      \
01331         PROTOCCALLSFFUN5 (T0,UN,LN,T1,T2,CF_0,CF_0,CF_0)

01333         PROTOCCALLSFFUN5 (T0,UN,LN,T1,T2,T3,CF_0,CF_0)

01349 #ifndef __CF__KnR
01350 #define PROTOCCALLSFFUN10(T0,UN,LN,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,TA)              \
01351 PU##T0(CFC_(UN,LN))(CF_NULL_PROTO);                                          \
01352 static _INT(2,U,T0,CFFUN(UN),0)(UCF(T1,1,0) UCF(T2,2,1) UCF(T3,3,1) UCF(T4,4,1)  \
01353    UCF(T5,5,1) UCF(T6,6,1) UCF(T7,7,1) UCF(T8,8,1) UCF(T9,9,1) UCF(TA,A,1)     \
01354                          HCF(T1,1) HCF(T2,2) HCF(T3,3) HCF(T4,4) HCF(T5,5)     \
01355                          HCF(T6,6) HCF(T7,7) HCF(T8,8) HCF(T9,9) HCF(TA,A) )   \
01356 {VCF(T1,1) VCF(T2,2) VCF(T3,3) VCF(T4,4) VCF(T5,5)                             \
01357  VCF(T6,6) VCF(T7,7) VCF(T8,8) VCF(T9,9) VCF(TA,A) E##T0                     \
01358  CCF(T1,1) CCF(T2,2) CCF(T3,3) CCF(T4,4) CCF(T5,5)                             \
01359  CCF(T6,6) CCF(T7,7) CCF(T8,8) CCF(T9,9) CCF(TA,A)                             \
01360  _INT(3,G,T0,UN,LN) CCCF(T1,1,0) CCCF(T2,2,1) CCCF(T3,3,1) CCCF(T4,4,1) CCCF(T5,5,1)\
01361                     CCCF(T6,6,1) CCCF(T7,7,1) CCCF(T8,8,1) CCCF(T9,9,1) CCCF(TA,A,1)\
01362                JCF(T1,1) JCF(T2,2) JCF(T3,3) JCF(T4,4) JCF(T5,5)               \
01363                JCF(T6,6) JCF(T7,7) JCF(T8,8) JCF(T9,9) JCF(TA,A));             \
01364  WCF(T1,A1,1) WCF(T2,A2,2) WCF(T3,A3,3) WCF(T4,A4,4) WCF(T5,A5,5)              \
01365  WCF(T6,A6,6) WCF(T7,A7,7) WCF(T8,A8,8) WCF(T9,A9,9) WCF(TA,AA,A) X##T0}
01366 #else
01367 #define PROTOCCALLSFFUN10(T0,UN,LN,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,TA)              \
01368 PU##T0(CFC_(UN,LN))(CF_NULL_PROTO);                                          \
01369 static _INT(2,U,T0,CFFUN(UN),0)(UUCF(T1,1,0) UUCF(T2,2,1) UUCF(T3,3,1) UUCF(T4,4,1) \
01370       UUCF(T5,5,1) UUCF(T6,6,1) UUCF(T7,7,1) UUCF(T8,8,1) UUCF(T9,9,1) UUCF(TA,A,1) \
01371                        HHCF(T1,1) HHCF(T2,2) HHCF(T3,3) HHCF(T4,4) HHCF(T5,5)  \
01372                        HHCF(T6,6) HHCF(T7,7) HHCF(T8,8) HHCF(T9,9) HHCF(TA,A)) \
01373  UUUCF(T1,1,0) UUUCF(T2,2,1) UUUCF(T3,3,1) UUUCF(T4,4,1) UUUCF(T5,5,1)         \
01374  UUUCF(T6,6,1) UUUCF(T7,7,1) UUUCF(T8,8,1) UUUCF(T9,9,1) UUUCF(TA,A,1)         \
01375            HHHCF(T1,1) HHHCF(T2,2) HHHCF(T3,3) HHHCF(T4,4) HHHCF(T5,5)         \
01376            HHHCF(T6,6) HHHCF(T7,7) HHHCF(T8,8) HHHCF(T9,9) HHHCF(TA,A);        \
01377 {VCF(T1,1) VCF(T2,2) VCF(T3,3) VCF(T4,4) VCF(T5,5)                             \
01378  VCF(T6,6) VCF(T7,7) VCF(T8,8) VCF(T9,9) VCF(TA,A) E##T0                     \
01379  CCF(T1,1) CCF(T2,2) CCF(T3,3) CCF(T4,4) CCF(T5,5)                             \
01380  CCF(T6,6) CCF(T7,7) CCF(T8,8) CCF(T9,9) CCF(TA,A)                             \
01381  _INT(3,G,T0,UN,LN) CCCF(T1,1,0) CCCF(T2,2,1) CCCF(T3,3,1) CCCF(T4,4,1) CCCF(T5,5,1)\
01382                     CCCF(T6,6,1) CCCF(T7,7,1) CCCF(T8,8,1) CCCF(T9,9,1) CCCF(TA,A,1)\
01383                JCF(T1,1) JCF(T2,2) JCF(T3,3) JCF(T4,4) JCF(T5,5)               \
01384                JCF(T6,6) JCF(T7,7) JCF(T8,8) JCF(T9,9) JCF(TA,A) );            \
01385  WCF(T1,A1,1) WCF(T2,A2,2) WCF(T3,A3,3) WCF(T4,A4,4) WCF(T5,A5,5)              \
01386  WCF(T6,A6,6) WCF(T7,A7,7) WCF(T8,A8,8) WCF(T9,A9,9) WCF(TA,AA,A) X##T0}
01387 #endif

01461 #define TBYTEVVV(       M,I,A,B,D)  (void *)A /* since we don't know the      */
01462 #define TBYTEVVVV(      M,I,A,B,D)  (void *)A /* dimensions of the array.     */
01463 #define TBYTEVVVVV(     M,I,A,B,D)  (void *)A /* i.e. Unfortunately, can't    */

01502 #define TPBYTE(         M,I,A,B,D)  A

01505 #define TPINT(          M,I,A,B,D)  A
01506 #define TPLOGICAL(      M,I,A,B,D)  ((*A=F2CLOGICAL(*A)),A)
01507 #define TPLONG(         M,I,A,B,D)  A

01510 #define TROUTINE(       M,I,A,B,D)  ROUTINE_##I  A
01511 /* A == pointer to the characters
01512    D == length of the string, or of an element in an array of strings
01513    E == number of elements in an array of strings                             */
01514 #define TTSTR(    A,B,D)                                                       \
01515                   ((B=malloc(D+1))[D]='\0', memcpy(B,A,D), kill_trailing(B,' '))
01516 #define TTTTSTR(  A,B,D)   (!(D<4||A[0]||A[1]||A[2]||A[3]))?NULL:              \
01517                             memchr(A,'\0',D)               ?A   : TTSTR(A,B,D)
01518 #define TTTTSTRV( A,B,D,E) (B##N=E,B=malloc(B##N*(D+1)), (void *)          \
01519   vkill_trailing(f2cstrv(A,B,D+1, B##N*(D+1)), D+1,B##N*(D+1),' '))
01520 #ifdef vmsFortran
01521 #define TSTRING(        M,I,A,B,D)  TTTTSTR( A->dsc$a_pointer,B,A->dsc$w_length)
01522 #define TSTRINGV(       M,I,A,B,D)  TTTTSTRV(A->dsc$a_pointer, B,              \
01523                                              A->dsc$w_length , A->dsc$l_m[0])
01524 #define TPSTRING(       M,I,A,B,D)    TTSTR( A->dsc$a_pointer,B,A->dsc$w_length)
01525 #define TPPSTRING(      M,I,A,B,D)           A->dsc$a_pointer
01526 #define TSTRVOID(        M,I,A,B,D)           A->dsc$a_pointer,A->dsc$w_length
01527 #else
01528 #ifdef CRAYFortran
01529 #define TSTRING(        M,I,A,B,D)  TTTTSTR( _fcdtocp(A),B,_fcdlen(A))
01530 #define TSTRINGV(       M,I,A,B,D)  TTTTSTRV(_fcdtocp(A),B,_fcdlen(A),         \
01531                               num_elem(_fcdtocp(A),_fcdlen(A),M##_STRV_##A))
01532 #define TPSTRING(       M,I,A,B,D)    TTSTR( _fcdtocp(A),B,_fcdlen(A))
01533 #define TPPSTRING(      M,I,A,B,D)           _fcdtocp(A)
01534 #define TSTRVOID(        M,I,A,B,D)           _fcdtocp(A),_fcdlen(A)
01535 #else
01536 #define TSTRING(        M,I,A,B,D)  TTTTSTR( A,B,D)
01537 #define TSTRINGV(       M,I,A,B,D)  TTTTSTRV(A,B,D,                            \
01538                                              num_elem(A,D,M##_STRV_##A))
01539 #define TPSTRING(       M,I,A,B,D)    TTSTR( A,B,D)
01540 #define TPPSTRING(      M,I,A,B,D)           A
01541 #define TSTRVOID(        M,I,A,B,D)           A,D
01542 #endif
01543 #endif
01544 #define TPNSTRING                   TSTRING
01545 #define TPSTRINGV                   TSTRINGV
01546 #define TCF_0(          M,I,A,B,D)

01548 #define RCF(TN,I)        STR_##TN(3,R,A##I,B##I,C##I,0)
01549 #define RLOGICAL( A,B,D)
01550 #define RPLOGICAL(A,B,D) *A=C2FLOGICAL(*A);
01551 #define RSTRING(  A,B,D) if (B) free(B);
01552 #define RSTRINGV( A,B,D) free(B);
01553 /* A and D as defined above for TSTRING(V) */
01554 #define RRRRPSTR( A,B,D) if (B) memcpy(A,B,PGSMIN(strlen(B),D)),                  \
01555                   (D>strlen(B)?memset(A+strlen(B),' ', D-strlen(B)):0), free(B);
01556 #define RRRRPSTRV(A,B,D) c2fstrv(B,A,D+1,(D+1)*B##N), free(B);
01557 #ifdef vmsFortran
01558 #define RPSTRING( A,B,D) RRRRPSTR( A->dsc$a_pointer,B,A->dsc$w_length)
01559 #define RPSTRINGV(A,B,D) RRRRPSTRV(A->dsc$a_pointer,B,A->dsc$w_length)
01560 #else
01561 #ifdef CRAYFortran
01562 #define RPSTRING( A,B,D) RRRRPSTR( _fcdtocp(A),B,_fcdlen(A))
01563 #define RPSTRINGV(A,B,D) RRRRPSTRV(_fcdtocp(A),B,_fcdlen(A))
01564 #else
01565 #define RPSTRING( A,B,D) RRRRPSTR( A,B,D)
01566 #define RPSTRINGV(A,B,D) RRRRPSTRV(A,B,D)
01567 #endif
01568 #endif
01569 #define RPNSTRING(A,B,D) RPSTRING( A,B,D)
01570 #define RPPSTRING(A,B,D)
01571 #define RSTRVOID(  A,B,D)

01573 #define FZBYTE(   UN,LN) INTEGER_BYTE     fcallsc(UN,LN)(

01582    The Apollo promotes K&R float functions to double. */

01591 #endif
01592 #endif
01593 #else

01596 #else
01597 #define FZFLOAT(  UN,LN) FLOATFUNCTIONTYPE fcallsc(UN,LN)(
01598 #endif
01599 #if defined(vmsFortran) || defined(CRAYFortran)
01600 #define FZSTRING( UN,LN) void  fcallsc(UN,LN)(AS
01601 #else
01602 #define FZSTRING( UN,LN) void  fcallsc(UN,LN)(AS, D0
01603 #endif
01604 #endif

01632 #define LLINT              A0=

01635 
01636 #define KINT            
01637 #define KVOID
01638 /* KSTRING copies the string into the position provided by the caller. */
01639 #ifdef vmsFortran
01640 #define KSTRING                                                                \
01641  memcpy(AS->dsc$a_pointer,A0, PGSMIN(AS->dsc$w_length,(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0))) ); \
01642  AS->dsc$w_length>(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0))?                                     \
01643   memset(AS->dsc$a_pointer+(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0)),' ',                        \
01644          AS->dsc$w_length-(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0))):0;
01645 #else
01646 #ifdef CRAYFortran
01647 #define KSTRING                                                                \
01648  memcpy(_fcdtocp(AS),A0, PGSMIN(_fcdlen(AS),(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0))) );           \
01649  _fcdlen(AS)>(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0))?                                          \
01650   memset(_fcdtocp(AS)+(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0)),' ',                             \
01651          _fcdlen(AS)-(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0))):0;
01652 #else
01653 #define KSTRING          memcpy(AS,A0, PGSMIN(D0,(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0))) );      \
01654                  D0>(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0))?memset(AS+(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0)), \
01655                                             ' ', D0-(A0==NULL?0:strlen(A0))):0;
01656 #endif
01657 #endif
01658 
01659 /* Note that K.. and I.. can't be combined since K.. has to access data before
01660 R.., in order for functions returning strings which are also passed in as
01661 arguments to work correctly. Note that R.. frees and hence may corrupt the
01662 string. */
01663 #define IBYTE          return A0;
01664 #define IDOUBLE        return A0;
01665 #ifndef sunFortran
01666 #define IFLOAT         return A0;
01667 #else
01668 #define IFLOAT         RETURNFLOAT(A0);
01669 #endif
01670 #define IINT           return A0;
01671 #define ILOGICAL       return C2FLOGICAL(A0);
01672 #define ILONG          return A0;
01673 #define ISHORT         return A0;
01674 #define ISTRING        return   ;
01675 #define IVOID          return   ;
